news.title: 'Everyone hit the deck and scattered': Witnesses describe moment of Utah shooting
news.summary: Witnesses describe screaming and running to flee the scene after hearing the fatal gunshot that killed Kirk.

news.title: Chelsea face 74 FA charges over payments to football agents
news.summary: Chelsea are charged by the Football Association with 74 alleged rule breaches related to payments to agents when Roman Abramovich was owner.

news.title: Barker and Thornberry pull out of deputy Labour leader race
news.summary: The remaining candidates have to get support from 80 MPs by 17:00 on Thursday to progress in the contest.

news.title: Dr Xand: Stress is normal. Here's how to manage it better
news.summary: Stress, in small doses, can be good for us. Here are five simple, science-backed ways to manage it better.

news.title: Harry's tea with Charles could be small but significant step to reconciliation
news.summary: The king and his son have met in person for the first time since February 2024 - but the clues a reunion was nearing have been there, writes senior royal correspondent Daniela Relph.

news.title: Children hacking their own schools for 'fun', watchdog warns
news.summary: The Information Commissioner's Office says schools face an "insider threat" from children as young as seven.

news.title: Sacked referee David Coote denies indecent child image charge
news.summary: The 43-year-old was charged following an investigation by Nottinghamshire Police.

news.title: A figure on the roof and a single bullet - what we know about Charlie Kirk shooting
news.summary: Details of the attack in Utah are still unclear, but a large manhunt is under way for the shooter.

news.title: Killing of Trump ally lays bare America's bloody and broken politics
news.summary: Charlie Kirk's killing is another episode of gun violence in America and the latest in a line of recent political violence.

news.title: 'A piece of me is gone': Ex-Liverpool player Andre Wisdom reflects on career-changing stabbing
news.summary: Five years after being stabbed, ex-Liverpool player Andre Wisdom is grateful he can still play after signing for non-league FC United of Manchester.
